description:
Python 3.11 was released on October 24th, bringing with it a new
`"specializing, adaptive
interpreter" <https://peps.python.org/pep-0659>`__. As one of the
engineers who works on this ambitious project, my goal is to introduce
you to the fascinating way that your code now *optimizes itself* as it's
running, and to explore the different techniques employed under-the-hood
to make your programs `25%
faster <https://docs.python.org/3/whatsnew/3.11.html#faster-cpython>`__
on average. Along the way, we'll also cover many of the challenges faced
when optimizing dynamic programming languages, some of the
`tools <https://github.com/brandtbucher/specialist>`__ you can use to
observe the new interpreter in action, and what we're already doing to
further improve performance in `Python
3.12 <https://github.com/faster-cpython/ideas/tree/main/3.12>`__ and
beyond.
title: Inside CPython 3.11's new specializing, adaptive interpreter.
